message.content:
<<<api>>>: XMLUnit
<<<code>>>: import org.custommonkey.xmlunit.Diff;
import org.custommonkey.xmlunit.XMLUnit;
import java.io.File;

public class XMLComparator {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        try {
            File file1 = new File("Compare.xml");
            File file2 = new File("Reference.xml");

            Diff diff = XMLUnit.compareXML(file1, file2);
            if (diff.similar()) {
                System.out.println("The XML files are identical.");
            } else {
                System.out.println("The XML files are different.");
                System.out.println(diff.toString());
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: To compare and get the difference between two XML files, you can use the XMLUnit library. First, include the XMLUnit library in your project. Then, create two File objects representing the XML files you want to compare. Use the compareXML() method from XMLUnit to compare the two files. If the files are identical, the similar() method will return true. If the files are different, you can use the toString() method of the Diff object to get a detailed difference report.
